column4: i dont know Ericthegreat, i've tried a few things but they usually make it not boot.
I get a mouse and ubuntu loading screen but nothing else happens I can't even ctrl+alt+F1 to get terminal
dual gpu laptop. but the nvidia one is turned off
the intel GMA is under unity supported devices, and i've gotten it to run unity in the past
by default it is, I have actually turned it off
it doesn't come up in "lshw -C video"
it did before I turned it off. I found a modprobe online
it's specifically for the asus UL series of laptops, I can link you if you want roothorick
do you have any intention of using your ATI card? Or do you only want to use the intel one
what happens if you type glxinfo
see if you can somehow disable your ati graphics card. Google guides for your specific laptop. I have no idea how, I Found a modprobe module for my laptop.
also see if you can forcibly remove the radeon drivers
after you do that you have to copy the new xorg.conf and replace the old one, I've gotta go. Good luck!
